title: Bug: Connected peers on Gnosis chain drops to 0 every 5 minutes
body:
Connected peers drops to zero every 5 minutes or so. Quickly increases back to 50ish after dropping.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/609945/204110652-c1534501-c419-478e-a17a-0b31fdfd8b4d.png)

Lodestar running in docker compose, latest version.

```
    command: |
      beacon
      --network=gnosis
      --dataDir=/data
      --preset=gnosis
      --eth1=true
      --execution.urls=http://execution:8551
      --jwt-secret=/jwt.hex
      --logFile=/lodestar/beacon.log
      --logFileLevel=info
      --port=9002
      --rest=true
      --rest.address=0.0.0.0
      --rest.port=4000
      --rest.cors=*
      --discv5=true
      --targetPeers=50
      --metrics=true
      --metrics.port=5054
      --checkpointSyncUrl=https://checkpoint.gnosischain.com/
      --suggestedFeeRecipient=0xREDACTED
```

**Desktop:**

- OS: `Linux alderlake 5.15.0-53-generic #59-Ubuntu SMP x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
- Version: `v1.2.2`
- Branch: `latest`
- Commit hash: `f093b46`

After a restart, it was stable for about 2 hours before having the same issue:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/609945/204130435-ec697b20-d56f-494c-b819-1f8c06788335.png)
